questions.question: Principal Component Analysis (PCA) belongs to which type of learning?

explanations.a: Incorrect: PCA does not use labeled data.
explanations.b: Incorrect: PCA does not involve reward-based learning.
explanations.c: Correct: PCA learns patterns from data without using labels.
explanations.d: Incorrect: PCA does not require partially labeled data.

questions.question: The main purpose of PCA is to:

answers.c: Reduce dimensionality while retaining important information

explanations.a: Incorrect: PCA reduces the number of variables.
explanations.b: Incorrect: PCA is not a classification algorithm.
explanations.c: Correct: PCA compresses data while preserving maximum information.
explanations.d: Incorrect: PCA may need normalization but does not perform it as its goal.

answers.b: Projecting data onto a lower-dimensional subspace
answers.d: Converting numerical data to categorical data

explanations.a: Incorrect: PCA does not randomly remove features.
explanations.b: Correct: PCA projects data into fewer principal components.
explanations.c: Incorrect: PCA transforms features instead of deleting them.
explanations.d: Incorrect: PCA works only on numerical data.

explanations.a: Incorrect: PCA captures maximum variance first.
explanations.b: Incorrect: PCA does not compute average variance components.
explanations.c: Correct: The first component explains the largest data variation.
explanations.d: Incorrect: PCA does not specifically isolate noise.

explanations.b: Incorrect: Parallel components would contain redundant information.
explanations.c: Correct: PCA components are perpendicular and uncorrelated.
explanations.d: Incorrect: Components are combinations of original features.

questions.question: One utility of PCA is that reduced features can be:

answers.c: Used as input to supervised learning algorithms

explanations.a: Incorrect: Reduced features still contain useful information.
explanations.b: Incorrect: PCA features are useful beyond visualization.
explanations.c: Correct: PCA features can be used for model training.
explanations.d: Incorrect: PCA is not limited to clustering tasks.

explanations.a: Incorrect: Eigenvectors represent directions, not samples.
explanations.b: Incorrect: PCA does not model error terms.
explanations.c: Correct: Eigenvectors define directions of maximum spread.
explanations.d: Incorrect: PCA does not use labels.

answers.c: Amount of variance explained by each principal component

explanations.a: Incorrect: Eigenvalues do not represent feature count.
explanations.b: Incorrect: Directions are defined by eigenvectors.
explanations.c: Correct: Eigenvalues measure variance captured by components.
explanations.d: Incorrect: PCA does not compute class probabilities.

questions.question: Eigenvectors and eigenvalues are obtained from the:

explanations.a: Incorrect: PCA is not based on distance matrices.
explanations.b: Incorrect: Identity matrix contains no variance information.
explanations.c: Correct: PCA uses covariance matrix decomposition.
explanations.d: Incorrect: Correlation matrix is optional, not mandatory.

questions.question: Principal components are selected mainly based on:

explanations.a: Incorrect: PCA components are ranked systematically.
explanations.b: Incorrect: Feature names do not affect PCA.
explanations.c: Correct: Higher eigenvalues indicate more important components.
explanations.d: Incorrect: Dataset size does not determine component importance.
